DOC.brief_summary: Total knee replacement is a painful procedure. Many solutions have been proposed to diminish the post-operative doses of narcotics, including nerve blocks. The purpose of the study is to compare if the adjunction of intra-articular ropivacaine to a femoral block is more effective on narcotics consumption than the block alone after TKR.
DOC.brief_title: Femoral Block With or Without Ropivacaine for Analgesia After Total Knee Replacement (TKR)
DOC.criteria: Primary total knee replacement Age > 18 years old Accept the study Revision surgery Use of anticoagulants drugs Neurologic disorder Unable to sign consent form
